text: Hello! I have a module that has a choice parameter that allows you to change the background color. I want to call that module in a section to choose the green background instead of the white default. What is the code I would need to add a module to a template that activates a particular choice?
one script doesn’t see the other… why do you have the function separated from the script call? why not just run myMethod() in the js file?
do you have an example of this on a page someone can look at, pretty hard to understand what is going on here
you want to have a module control a section in the drag and drop editor? You can’t do that
If you are trying to do something else, can you try to explain it a bit differently?
ill try seeing if i can get permisison to share out the page
but the issue is when i recreate it on a test page it works perfectly fine
when doesn’t it work?
on the actual homepage
so i dont know if other modules are conflicting with it
so, on a page by itself, it works fine
on another page, it doesn’t show them all
yea
okay
so lets figure out if we can work thorught his. I suspect there could be a missing or an extra close div tag or something like that
on your test page that works
add a module above it, save and preview your page
see if it works still, then after yous ave and review, add a module to the bottom underneath your module, save and preview
then, do it wiht just the module below and test that, and let me know your results.
will do thanks
Probably too late to reply but I found this in another thread: <https://github.com/ericsalvi/Add-Reading-Minutes-to-Blog-Posts>

Technically you could - I once created a module that used JavaScript to find the parent dnd-section, add a class and style it based on module options. I can't remember the use case, and it's obviously not ideal (especially for anything above the fold that might be a little jumpy), but could be done.
